articles.author: NPR
articles.title: What will it take to get measles under control? - NPR
articles.description:
It's been 25 years since measles was officially "eliminated" from the United States.

That's a technical term. In public health, it means measles has not had a steady twelve month spread.

Right now there are measles cases in several states The …
articles.content:
A person walks past a sign at a health center where the MMR (measles-mumps-rubella) vaccine is administered in Lubbock, Texas earlier this year.
RONALDO SCHEMIDT/AFP via Getty Images

articles.author: Kyle Orland
articles.title: Will Mario Kart World’s $80 price become gaming’s new normal? - Ars Technica
articles.description: Adjusting for inflation shows console game prices have been higher in the recent past.
